fields.summary: [R] Unable to install R's arrow on RStudio

comments.body: Thanks for reporting! You wouldn't happen to be on CentOS7, would you? We recently moved to C++17, for which there isn't support on the default compiler for that platform.

It's the same issue, your compiler (gcc 6.3) is apparently too old. string_view is part of C++17. [~apitrou] would it be worth having cmake test for the existence of string_view and/or other features and erroring informatively if they're not available, just to make it clear what the issue is in circumstances like these?

A workaround is to install a newer compiler. https://arrow.apache.org/docs/r/articles/install.html#compilers describes how to do this on CentOS 7; you'd want something similar. 

Incidentally, Debian stretch is EOL and is no longer receiving security updates: https://www.debian.org/releases/stretch/ If you are able to upgrade, it would be a good idea.
Ah thank you for that explanation and suggestion, I'll work with the internal team's at my company to get both of those updated.

Ideally this CMake configuration ensures that C++17 is selected. I don't know why it doesn't complain explicitly if the compiler is too old:
https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/3b852e49fec85b57545c6edc6c66d3da93de2c06/cpp/cmake_modules/SetupCxxFlags.cmake#L125-L130

Ah, but I see gcc has started adding C++17 features in gcc 5, so gcc 6.3 might accept setting the C\+\+ standard version to C\+\+17. It just won't have all the required features (neither will libstdc\+\+).
